text: Love the yogurt there =) makes me feel less guilty when i eat yogurt!

Mon petit chouchou montréalais à cause du  climat avoisinant les 30 degrés chaque jours mais bon je ne me plein pas j'adore le soleil! 

N'empêche qu'en période de tourisme intense associée à de fortes chaleurs ba c'est quand même pas mal d'avoir un petit endroit où se rafraîchir en mangeant un mélange de glace/yaourt/smoothie! 

Les plus:
- la quantité de parfum.
- les garnitures que l'on peu rajouter (chocolat, bonbon, fraise, fruits, sauces ...).
- Le wifi (ba oui lorsque l'on est pas montréalaise et que l'on ne possède pas un forfait international on est bien contente d'avoir un wifi gratuit!!! 
- la deco: des couleurs vives et bien pétantes avec un max de polaroids sur les murs moi perso j'adore. 
- la super terrasse bien à l'ombre au bout de la rue (super animé) sainte Catherine... 
- le personnel super sympa. 

Les moins:
- je n'ai trouvé qu'un seul point négatif les prix. 5,35 dollars pour 222g c'est un peu abusé. Le prix est en fonction du poids vu que c'est nous qui nous servons mais presque 22 dollars le kilo ba ça m'empêche de mettre le 5 étoiles!!

Kinda a sad chain of frozen yogurt. Given the location of this specific store, you can't take it seriously either. It's nestled in a shady part of town, rampant with places called "Sex Village" and "Boutique Erotika". It's half a block away from a grimey strip club and surrounded by open late fast food joints fitting for the degenerate crowd wandering this sad street block.

It simply does NOT compare to U.S. Red Mango and Pinkberry chains, or even any of the smaller lesser known chains. I sampled each flavor out of curiosity and each couldn't have been any more artificial. I would definitely not shell out any money out of pocket if you're visiting Montreal. 

I'll say the cashier was nice enough to give us multiple small sample paper cups, but the flavors are artificial and nothing special.
Was in the area and decided to come here to get some frozen yogurt! It was pretty good, and has a huge variety of flavours/toppings to choose from

Le concept est simple...
Tu te sers en yogourt glacé parmis 10 parfums, tu ajoutes tes garnitures (ou pas) et tu fais peser...
Un petit peu cher mais vraiment très bon... Surtout l'originale et celle au chocolat !!!

Such a good but small selection of yogurt flavors here. 
I mixed milk and cookies, salted caramel and Greek yogurt with honey!!

The salted caramel and the Greek with honey were the best!

The topping selection is pretty standard. 
It would be even more awesome if they offered more crunchy cereal toppings!

This is a very casual environment, and if you're craving some yummy yogurt flavors, I would make your way over here!

THE BEST YEH! SHOP IN MONTREAL!
There's less people than the Eaton Center one and the Guy-Concordia one, and it's spacious, well decorated and comfortable. My friends and I have designated it our go-to hang out spot. VIVA YEH

Quite expensive. But when it's hot out you will be glad you stopped by. Variety of flavours with a lot of fresh and sweet toppings to add. 

They charge by weight so don't get too carried away.
J'adore le concept, on mets autant de glace  au yaourt et de topping que l'on veut. Je suis juste fane de ce dessert

Yeh is a franchise so the taste and look are the same everywhere but I must admit, it's devilishly delicious. As usual, you stuff your cup with whatever you please and then it gets weighed. For a regular fill you'll pay something around $5. Be careful - I know your eyes are bigger than your tummy! The cups are big so it looks like less than it actually is. They also make waffles and sandwiches but who'd choose that over Fro-Yo?! Not you!
It's quite spacious and when we went, it was almost empty and there were plenty of seats. The guy behind the counter seems pretty chilled (best job ever?).
